title: East Fjords

image.alt: Dramatic East Fjords landscape with mountains and ocean

quote.text: The mountains are calling and I must go.
quote.author: John Muir

summary: Journey through Iceland's spectacular East Fjords, a region of winding coastal roads, dramatic mountain vistas, and colorful fishing villages. Today's adventure takes you from the lobster capital of H√∂fn to the remote Borgarfj√∂r√∞ur Eystri, with stunning photo stops, hidden waterfalls, and mineral collections along the way. The East Fjords offer a more authentic glimpse of Iceland away from the crowds, with landscapes that rival the country's more famous attractions.

schedule.title: Breakfast near H√∂fn
schedule.description: Start your day with breakfast at Netto bakery in H√∂fn, which opens early and offers fresh pastries and coffee.

schedule.title: Drive to Vestrahorn
schedule.description: Depart early for Vestrahorn mountain and Stokksnes beach to take advantage of morning light for photography.

schedule.title: Vestrahorn and Stokksnes Beach
schedule.description: Experience one of Iceland's most photogenic mountains with its jagged peaks rising dramatically above a black sand beach. The reflections in the wet sand during low tide create stunning photo opportunities.
details: 756m high mountain with striking jagged peaks
Black sand beach with perfect mountain reflections
Viking village film set nearby (when open)
Entry fee paid at Viking Caf√© near the entrance

schedule.title: East Fjords Coastal Drive
schedule.description: Begin the spectacular drive along the East Fjords, one of Iceland's most scenic coastal routes. The winding road takes you through deep fjords, past towering mountains, and through small fishing villages.
details: Dramatic scenery with mountains plunging into the sea
Multiple viewpoints perfect for photo stops
Keep an eye out for wildlife including reindeer and seabirds
Much less crowded than other parts of Iceland
Road occasionally narrows to one lane but traffic is light
quickStops: Almannaskar√∞ Pass - panoramic viewpoint just outside H√∂fn
Eystrahorn mountain - dramatic peak visible from the road
Hvalnes Lighthouse - iconic orange lighthouse on a black beach

schedule.title: Lunch in Dj√∫pivogur
schedule.description: Stop for lunch in this charming fishing village, known for its artistic flair and relaxed atmosphere. The Vi√∞ Voginn restaurant offers fresh local seafood and other Icelandic specialties.
quickStops: Eggin √≠ Gle√∞iv√≠k (The Eggs of Merry Bay) - outdoor art installation of 34 stone eggs representing local bird species

schedule.title: The Waterfall Circle
schedule.description: Embark on this magical hike featuring nearly ten diverse waterfalls in the eastern highlands. This 5-mile loop trail takes you through varied landscapes with waterfalls of different shapes and sizes.
details: 5-mile (8km) moderate loop trail taking about 3 hours
Trailhead at Laugarfell Guesthouse, accessible with your car
Features multiple waterfalls including Faxi, Kirkjufoss, and Stu√∞lafoss
Relatively unknown trail with few other hikers
Some uneven terrain but no technical climbing required

schedule.title: Petra's Stone Collection
schedule.description: Visit this unique museum housing an extensive private collection of East Iceland minerals and stones, gathered by local resident Petra Sveinsd√≥ttir throughout her lifetime.
details: Thousands of rocks and minerals collected from the surrounding East Fjords
Beautiful garden setting with stones arranged throughout
Many rare specimens specific to Iceland's unique geology
Founded by Petra who began collecting rocks as a child in the 1940s

schedule.title: Vestdalsfossar Waterfall Viewpoint
schedule.description: Stop at this viewpoint overlooking a series of beautiful cascades flowing from the mountains down to the fjord below.

schedule.title: Check in at Alfheimar Hotel
schedule.description: Arrive at your accommodation in Borgarfj√∂r√∞ur Eystri and get settled for the evening.

schedule.title: Dinner at Alfheimar Hotel Restaurant
schedule.description: Enjoy dinner at the hotel restaurant, which serves traditional Icelandic cuisine using locally-sourced ingredients.

highlights: Photographing the dramatic peaks of Vestrahorn mountain
The scenic coastal drive through the East Fjords
Discovering multiple waterfalls on the Waterfall Circle hike
Exploring unique minerals at Petra's Stone Collection

accommodation.name: Alfheimar Hotel
accommodation.roomType: Standard Double or Twin Room, Patio
accommodation.notes: Note that a small cruise ship (Azamara Quest, 698 passengers) will be docking in the region today, but most East Fjords attractions are spread out enough that crowds shouldn't be an issue if you start early.

alternatives.title: Str√∫tsfoss Waterfall
alternatives.description: Larger red strata waterfall than the famous Hengifoss. This easy family-friendly hike takes you to a truly impressive waterfall with distinctive red rock layers similar to Hengifoss but with fewer visitors.

alternatives.title: Hengifoss and Litlanesfoss Waterfall Hike
alternatives.description: 3-mile round trip hike to see Iceland's third-highest waterfall (128m) with distinctive red clay and black basalt layers. On the way, you'll also pass Litlanesfoss, framed by giant hexagonal basalt columns.

alternatives.title: Atlavik Beach
alternatives.description: Peaceful fjord beach surrounded by forest - a rarity in Iceland. Features picnic tables and hiking trails through the trees. A tranquil spot to relax by the water.

alternatives.title: Papey Island Boat Tour
alternatives.description: Boat tour to abandoned island with abundant birdlife including puffins. The island was inhabited until 1966 and contains Iceland's oldest and smallest wooden church.

alternatives.title: Teigarhorn Nature Reserve
alternatives.description: Famous geological site known for its zeolite crystal formations. Features a small museum in a historic house and short walking paths with coastal views.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Skaftfell Center for Visual Art
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Contemporary art gallery showcasing works by local and international artists, with a focus on East Iceland's artistic heritage.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Wilderness Center
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Museum and exhibition about life in the Icelandic highlands, featuring interactive displays, historical artifacts, and stories of survival in harsh conditions.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: East Iceland Heritage Museum
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Collection of historical artifacts showcasing the cultural history and daily life in East Iceland through the centuries.

tip: The East Fjords have Iceland's largest population of wild reindeer. They were introduced in the 18th century and are most commonly spotted in this region, especially in the morning and evening hours.
notes: This is a long driving day with multiple stops, so keeping to schedule is important. The roads through the East Fjords are paved but winding, with occasional single-lane bridges and tunnels. Note that the Azamara Quest cruise ship will be in port today with 698 passengers, so some locations might be busier than usual during midday hours.
